intro: Galatella angustissima, commonly known as the narrow-leaved galatella, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded environments. Galatella angustissima is often found in rocky or limestone areas, where it contributes to the biodiversity of Mediterranean flora.
